p: With an estimated 1,700 breeding pairs the YEP is one of the rarest penguin species world-wide ( Garcia Borboroglu & Boersma, 2013). Compared to other penguins, the YEP’s distributional range is fairly limited. About 60% of the species’ population is thought to inhabit the sub-Antarctic Auckland and Campbell Islands, while the remaining ∼40% breed along the south-eastern coastline of New Zealand’s South Island ( Seddon, Ellenberg & van Heezik, 2013). Genetic analyses revealed that there is virtually no gene flow between the sub-Antarctic and mainland YEP populations ( Boessenkool et al., 2009a).
